isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - SYSTEM DESCRIPTION - AXLE MOUNTING LOCATIONS

svcsubproc.title: PUSHER AXLES
svcsubproc.para: Pusher axles are mounted ahead of the rear drive axles ( FIGURE 3) . Depending on the application, the following things may vary between pusher axles:

item.para: maximum load capacity of the lift axle assembly,
mounting distance between drive axle and nearest pusher axle,
mounting distance between pusher axles (when two pusher axles are used),
ride height of the pusher axle.

svcsubproc.para: These items are selected before lift axle installation and are not changeable after installation.

calloutgroup.callout1: A. SPACING BETWEEN DRIVE AXLE AND NEAREST PUSHER AXLE
C. SPACING BETWEEN DRIVE AXLE AND TAG AXLE

svcsubproc.title: TAG AXLES
svcsubproc.para: Tag axles are mounted behind the rear drive axles (FIGURE 3). Depending on the application, the following things may vary between tag axles:

item.para: maximum load capacity of the axle,
mounting distance between drive axle and tag axle,
ride height of the tag axle.

svcsubproc.para: These items are selected before lift axle installation and are not changeable after installation.

svcsubproc.title: AXLE SPACING
svcsubproc.para: The optimum spacing between the drive axle(s) and the lift axles (and between multiple lift axles) is determined by the vehicle application. This spacing is set when the lift axle is installed. Once installed, the axle spacing is not adjustable and has no effect on the maintenance of the system.
